_json.gridTitle: First Direct Evidence of Neuroinflammation – ‘Encephalitis’ – in ME/CFS
_json.description: First Direct Evidence of Neuroinflammation – ‘Encephalitis’ – in ME/CFS April 29, 2014:  Simon McGrath reports on the new study that indicates low-grade encephalitis in ME/CFS … A small study with just nine patients has captured the attention of patients and researchers alike after reporting direct evidence of inflammation in the brain of ME/CFS patients. The finding was one of the highlights picked out by Professor Anthony Komaroff in his IACFS/ME conference round up.
